Posts.Content: May 27, 2011 02:54AM TysMom wrote: Interesting about the no pain while on chemo.  I was just saying the same thing to the lady I work with today.  The 2 weeks I have treatment there is no pain, the week off isn't really pain but pressure that makes it uncomfortable to lay on my right side, or raise my arm above my head for radiation. I am not taking anything now except for the occasional Aleve that my onc said was fine because it is only once or twice every 3 weeks.  I do have  oxycodone but don't feel like I really need it at this point.

Posts.Content: TysMom wrote: Anyone have any trouble with this during treatment?  I have been having a rapid heartbeat since last week when I had radiation and chemo on the same day.  That is the first time I had it at the same time.  I was really wiped out over the weekend.  Yesterday I had chenoemzar and radiation.  That will be the last time that it happens that way since next week is my off week and I am done with rads next Wed. I am scheduled for a MUGA scan just to check things out, my last one in September was was good and MO also is checking my thyroid. I am convinced that it is from having rads and chemo together since it started 2 days after treatment. Any ideas? Dx 4/15/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/17 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
